channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flank wall of No 1 Sandy Road, 8th February
item.description:
Essential street lamp failed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sandy Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road and pavements covered in dog foul., 8th February
item.description:
I visit my nan on a weekly basis, as she can’t get out much. One neighbour blocks the road with there bins so I can’t park near to my nans house and has been doing this for over a year now. Also when I visit not only do I end up driving in dog foul while pulling into a parking space the amount on the pavements is absolutely disgusting. Today there were 3 lots in the road, one in which I drove over and I counted 5 lots of mess walking 3 houses down to my nans house.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Marmadon Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose flag stone, 8th February
item.description:
Outside 79 Raeburn Road am where the drive / dropped kerb meets the road, one of the long flag stones has dislodged and moves like a see-saw if driven over. This in turn forces a jet of water up into the air and is becoming more loose and is likely to flick up and hit the underside of any vehicle travelling over it. Also a trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Raeburn Road, Falconwood, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crash damaged / stolen and dumped 69 plate BMW 3 series blue, 8th February
item.description:
Suspected stolen car, crashed and dumped after being used by joyriders in hobblingwell rec carpark. Car was seen doing donuts then crashed into curb smashing off rear wheel. Passenger footwell full of laughing gas canisters
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constantly clearing up dog mess, 8th February
item.description:
Alleyway between 20 and 22 flintmill crescent has constant dog mess. Please at least put up a sign with 'Cctv in operation' or something that will attempt to stop these reprobates from picking up after their animals.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Flintmill Crescent, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet
